conclusion: Analyze the projectile's motion to determine the height H at which it hits the building.
Projectile is launched at angle θ = 53° with initial velocity v0 = 50 m/s.
Calculate cos 53° using Pythagorean identity: cos 53° = 0.6.
Horizontal component of initial velocity v0x = 50 × 0.6 = 30 m/s.
Vertical component of initial velocity v0y = 50 × 0.8 = 40 m/s.
Calculate time of flight to reach building: t = L / v0x = 60 / 30 = 2 s.
Calculate vertical displacement y using equation of motion: y = v0y × t - 0.5 × g × t².
Substitute values to find y: y = 40 × 2 - 0.5 × 10 × 2² = 60 m.
Height H at which projectile hits building is 60 m.
